body: Oops, I misunderstood it. @danielgindi do you think this is caused in 3.0? I remember when I used it in 2.0, it works fine.
I've set up axisDependency, but it seems it doesn't work. As far as I know, it doesn't work in CombinedChartView. Other charts work well.
I checked your issue, it seems like you are correct. Waiting for @danielgindi. I used combined chart in 2.x version, and it work like your way. I didn't check in Chart 3.0

Same here, Combined Chart (Bar and Line) user to work smoothly in 2.x. Shows errors in 3.x

![screen shot 2016-11-16 at 10 02 09 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21377276/20334886/c8559732-abe3-11e6-9ff9-63b6596451d9.png)
@vaibhav-varshaaweblabs don't put irrelevant issues here. It's your code that's not compatible with 3.0 APIs. DO CHECK the 3.0 release notes.
@brxren I guess you already found the root cause and fix? Mind to file a PR?

@liuxuan30 Should I wait for @danielgindi 's response?
BTW,  I'm a rookie here. Would you like to tell me what 'PR' is short for and how to file it?
PR = pull requests. I feel it's like a bug.. but we could also wait :)

OK, got it.
I think it's not urgent. I have fixed it in my source code.
BUT I'm not sure if it will cause other problems, so waiting for @danielgindi is better.
I confirm having the same bug and it worked in previous versions (<3.0).

issue.title: fix the issue with axis dependencies

repository.name: Charts
repository.description: Beautiful charts for iOS/tvOS/OSX! The Apple side of the crossplatform MPAndroidChart.

issue.body: Axis dependencies on combined charts were ignored. Fix to the issue https://github.com/danielgindi/Charts/issues/1830
